register.name: PMCCFILTR_EL0
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Cycle Count Filter Register
register.description: Determines the modes in which the Cycle Counter, PMCCNTR_EL0, increments.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hypervisor) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: Secure EL3 filtering bit. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

register.name: PMCCNTR_EL0
register.description: Holds the value of the processor Cycle Counter, CCNT, that counts processor clock cycles. See for more information...

bitField.name: CCNT
bitField.description: Cycle count. Depending on the values of PMCR_EL0.

register.name: PMCEID0_EL0
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 0
register.description: Defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events in the ranges 0x0000 to 0x001F and 0x4000 to 0x401F are implemented. If a particular bit is set to 1, then the event for that bit is implemented.

bitField.name: ID_16415_16384
bitField.description: PMCEID0_EL0[63:32] maps to common events 0x4000 to 0x401F. For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

bitField.name: ID_31_0
bitField.description: PMCEID0_EL0[31:0] maps to common events 0x0000 to 0x001F. For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

register.name: PMCEID1_EL0
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 1
register.description: Defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events in the ranges 0x0020 to 0x003F and 0x4020 to 0x403F are implemented. If a particular bit is set to 1, then the event for that bit is implemented.

bitField.name: ID_16447_16416
bitField.description: PMCEID1_EL0[63:32] maps to common events 0x4020 to 0x403F. For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

bitField.name: ID_63_32
bitField.description: PMCEID1_EL0[31:0] maps to common events 0x0020 to 0x003F. For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

register.name: PMCNTENCLR_EL0
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Count Enable Clear register
register.description: Disables the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR_EL0, and any implemented event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading this register shows which counters are enabled.

bitField.description: PMCCNTR_EL0 disable bit. Disables the cycle counter register.

register.name: PMCR_EL0
register.description: Provides details of the Performance Monitors implementation, including the number of counters implemented, and configures and controls the counters.

bitField.name: IMP
bitField.description: Implementer code. This field is RO with an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED value.

bitField.name: IDCODE
bitField.description: Identification code. This field is RO with an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED value.

bitField.name: N
bitField.description: Number of event counters. A RO field that indicates the number counters implemented. A value of 0b00000 in this field indicates that only the Cycle Count Register PMCCNTR_EL0 is implemented.

bitField.name: LC
bitField.description: Long cycle counter enable. Determines which PMCCNTR_EL0 bit generates an overflow recorded by PMOVSR[31].

bitField.name: DP
bitField.description: Disable cycle counter when event counting is prohibited.

bitField.name: X
bitField.description: Enable export of events in an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event stream.

bitField.name: D
bitField.description: Clock divider.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cycle counter reset. This bit is WO.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Event counter reset. This bit is WO.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable.

register.description: Configures event counter n, where n is 0 to 30.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hypervisor) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: Secure EL3 filtering bit. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Multithreading.

bitField.name: evtCount_15_10
bitField.description: Extension to evtCount[9:0]. See evtCount[9:0] for more details.

bitField.name: evtCount_9_0
bitField.description: Event to count. The event number of the event that is counted by event counter PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0.

bitField.name: M

tcf:enumItem.description: If PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0 is enabled and configured to count the software increment event, increments PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0 by 1. If PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0 is disabled, or not configured to count the software increment event, the write to this bit is ignored.
tcf:enumItem.name: If_PMEVCNTR_n_EL0_is_enabled_and_configured_to_count_the_software_increment_event_increments_PMEVCNTR_n_EL0_by_1

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
